channel.title: Nokia suing Apple
channel.description:
Nokia is suing its rival Apple for infringing patents on mobile phone technology for the iPhone. The world's biggest mobile phone maker accused Apple of “attempting to get a free ride on the back of Nokia's innovation”. The phone company said in a statement: "The patents cover wireless data, speech coding, security and encryption and are infringed by all Apple iPhone models shipped since the iPhone was introduced in 2007.” Nokia filed the complaint against Apple, which relates to 10 patents, with the Federal District Court in Delaware in the US. Earlier this month Nokia posted its first quarterly loss in a decade amid falling sales. Analysts said the poor results were partly due to the growing popularity of Apple's iPhone and RIM's Blackberry over Nokia models. Nokia said it has spent 40 billion euros (£36 billion) in research and development over the past two decades. "The ten patents in suit relate to technologies fundamental to making devices which are compatible with one or more of the GSM, UMTS (3G WCDMA) and wireless LAN standards," Nokia said.
http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/World-News/iPhone-Nokia-Suing-Rival-Apple-For-Infringing-Patents-On-Mobile-Phone-Technology/Article/200910415411864?lpos=World_News_Top_Stories_Header_2&lid=ARTICLE_15411864_iPhone%3A_Nokia_Suing_Rival_Apple_For_Infringing_Patents_On_Mobile_Phone_Technology total kickass, I'm looking forward to see apple lose tons of money

item.title: Nokia suing Apple
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

this’ll prolly take a couple of years… I don’t really care who wins.
And ipods and iphones have a great UX imo. Really intuitive and well designed interfaces. The appstore and lack of customization in the iphone/itouch really suck though.

Read full topic

item.title: Nokia suing Apple
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The only thing I like about the ipods is that they use a HDD instead of flash memory (and can therefore offer far larger capacities).
I’m not aware of any players that offer the same sort of capacities that ipods do.
